abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental assessment
            (EA) for the Privatization Technical Assistance Credit
            Project, under which four key public enterprises will be
            privatized. As part of the divestiture processes,
            environmental issues are being addressed during project
            preparation, by including audits to analyze existing
            conditions at, and around specific sites, and facilities of
            the enterprises. The EA presents the results of the
            environmental pre-audits, ranking the enterprises with
            respect to requirements either for comprehensive or full
            audit, partial, or no audit. Environmental concerns include
            soil degradation, rapid deforestation, desertification, and
            droughts, in addition to constraints in generation,
            transmission and distribution of electricity to the national
            grid from hydropower dams, and gas fired thermal plants,
            with some immediate concerns, such as water, air, and noise
            pollution, poor sanitation, drainage, and solid waste
            management. Comprehensive, and partial audits address: 1)
            development of appropriate waste management practices
            regarding solid wastes, including oil spill contingency
            plans for the prevention, and control of spillage into
            downstream waters; 2) training assessment on environmental
            management plans, in accordance with the regulatory
            framework, and in liaison with the Ministry of the
            Environment; and, development of environmental mitigation,
            performance indicators, and monitoring; and, 3)
            identification of equipment decommissioning plans, in
            compliance with World Bank guidelines.
